ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: in spite of any excuses he might offer.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Whatever the excuses he may offer.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: even though he might make up excuses.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: And even if he presents all the excuses he has, none will be listened to.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Though he may put forth his excuses.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Though he puts forth his excuses.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: even though he offer his excuses.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: in spite of all the excuses he may offer.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Although he may put forth his pleas.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: though he should offer excuses [to justify his failings].
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Even though he were to put up his excuses.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Though he may put forth his excuses (to cover his evil deeds).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: even though he offers his excuses.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: Even as he presents his excuses.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: Even if he presents his excuses.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [75:15] though he should offer his excuses (ma‘ādhīr is the plural of ma‘dhira, but following a different pattern [from the usual ma‘dhira, ma‘ādhir]) that is to say, whatever excuse he offers will not be accepted from him.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (Although he tender his excuses) and says: I have not done this and have not said that; it is also said that this means: every soul is aware of the faults of others, ignorant of and oblivious to its own faults.
